description.narrative: The Somalia Joint Programme on Human Rights will be executed by UNSOM, UNICEF and UNDP, with UNSOM acting as the lead entity, in coordination with the Government, particularly the Ministry of Women and Human Rights Development.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Multi Partner Trust Fund for Somalia

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Multi Partner Trust Fund for Somalia

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Support provided to one Inter-Ministerial Committee to oversee implementation of Human Rights Roadmap including the domestication of Convention on the Rights of the Child, UPR, and NAP/SVC is established/strengthened.
Number of technical staff inducted on human rights commitments and activities is strengthened
Number and frequency of coordination meetings convened by the inter-ministerial and committee and federal task-force on CRC, Steering Committee on the NAP/SVC with relevant regional state ministries
Mechanism for the implementation of a comprehensive juvenile justice is initiated.
Number of Ministry of Women and Human Rights staff/officers and other line ministries trained on human rights monitoring and implementation
Mechanism for monitoring, reporting, tracking and addressing human rights violations developed and managed by MoWHRD for each of the SNA, SPF, NISA, and Attorney-General’s Office is in place
Number of draft laws and policies on the nexus between human rights, justice and security developed in line with human rights standards with the support of the inter-ministerial task force (Security and Defence related legislations/Policies)
One treaty ratification action plan developed by MoFA for treaties Somalia accepted to consider in the UPR process
Number of training sessions provided to prosecutors in the FGS and FMS on human rights, juvenile justice and general criminal justice
Number of human rights and security related legislation developed and reviewed by the different human rights and security committees
Number of consultation meetings organized by human rights and security committees to engage in dialogue with citizens on draft legislation
Number of training sessions on human rights and legislative drafting/review conducted for the relevant committees
Established and functional electronic database with human rights related studies and data, which would be constantly updated and include specialized human rights sub-areas to suppo

comment.narrative:
Steering Committee on the implementation of the NAP/SVC in place
Loose Task Force on the UPR exist
Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) ratified
Capacity of the Ministry of Women and Human Rights is weak with only one staff member for thematic areas
Informal coordination mechanism
Absence of a coordination mechanism within key FGS line ministries and/with Federal Member States
Absence of appropriate mechanisms and framework Puntland Juvenile Justice Law
Basic knowledge of human rights issues exists
Women and Child Protection Unit in SPF, no other monitoring mechanisms in place
Human Rights Roadmap, National Action Plan on Ending Sexual Violence, Action Plans on Children and Armed Conflict
Sensitization on CEDAW undertaken (UNFPA)
No specific training provided on human rights to the prosecutors
Federal Constitution of Somalia, Draft Federal Constitution, Sexual Offences Bill, Penal Code, Citizenship Bill, Anti-FGM Bill, International treaties requiring domestication. Convention on the Rights of the Child
New Parliamentary Committees being constituted
Training conducted for general legislative drafting vis-a-vis existence of new committees
Absence of a database
New Parliamentary Committees being constituted
0 periodic meetings held with civil society organizations, think tanks, and academic institutions to strengthen inclusive participation and building constructive dialogue on human rights in security service delivery
0 working sessions by human rights and security committees on budgetary/financial oversight and analysis with specific focus on human rights
Federal Constitution of Somalia, Penal Code, Sexual Offences Bill, Anti-FGM Bill, Citizenship Bill
0 multi-year strategic plan for the Human Rights Commission
No HR Commission is in place. Establishment process not yet commenced although selection of commissioners started.
No Commission exists.
Baseline is zero as the commission is yet to be established
0 reports produced inclu

1. Agreement or communique signed with key measures on how to safeguard the participation of women candidates and delegates during the 2021 elections 2. 1 website and linked database developed to gather and share information on elections and human rights violations, with a special focus on the 30% women quota 3. National report on Somalia’s third cycle UPR is finalized 4. Position paper with recommendations against proposed amendments violating international human rights Somali Provisional Constitution has been developed through wide consultations with various stakeholders 5. 1 theatre play with different sketches developed 6. Initiation of a system to follow-up and monitor the implementation of the various international human rights treaty body recommendations and obligations

1. Agreement developed and signed by the MoWHRD and Ministry of Internal Security on the protection of female candidates and delegates during the 2021 election 2. 1 wesbite with database developed, launched and is being used to gather and share information on human rights violations during the elections 3. MoWHRD has developed, consulted on and finalized the national report on Somalia’s 3rd cycle UPR 4. Position paper was developed and consulted on. However, the programme ended before the official launch could be conducted 5. The MoWHRD worked with a local theatre group developed a theater play with different sketches on various human rights thematic areas, such as child rights and the rights of persons with disabilities 6. The MoWHRD developed the national mechanism on reporting and follow-up of international human rights treaty body obligations and UPR recommendations

1.1.1: 3 training workshops for Inter-Ministerial Committee, with all members of Committee and relevant staff trained 1.1.2: 6 review meetings with technical staff in the MoWHRD on specific issues that need deeper technical training 1.1.3a: Human Rights Inter-Ministerial Task Force – 4 coordination meetings 1.1.3b: CAAC – CAAC Working group 4 coordination meetings 1.1.3c: National Coordination Mechanism at DG-level on CAAC 4 coordination meetings 1.1.3d: Inter-Ministerial Coordination Meeting on Child Protection 12 coordination meetings 1.1.3e: NAP Steering Committee – 2 coordination meetings convened at national level. 1.1.3f: Gender-Based Violence Working Group – 12 coordination meetings 1.1.3g: Pillar 9 Working Group on Human Rights and Gender – 12 coordination meetings 1.1.3h: Social Development Roadmap – 52 coordination meetings 1.2.1: 1 draft legislation reviewed by human rights and security committees on its compliance with human rights 1.2.2: 4 Training sessions on human rights and legislative drafting/review for the relevant Federal Parliamentary committees 2.1.1a: 6 trainings for Human rights civil society organisations on advocacy and engagement with national authorities in Mogadishu and the regions 2.1.1b: 3 panel discussions for human rights civil society organisations on human rights protection system 2.1.2: 1 workshop for human rights civil society organisations on human rights, juvenile justice and women protection issues 3.1.1: Disability conference to generate disability road map and national legal frame 3.1.2a: 1 action plan for implementation of the persons with disabilities rights priorities under the National Disability Roadmap 3.1.2b: 1 gap analysis for implementation of the persons with disabilities rights priorities under the National Disability Roadmap

1.1.1: The inter-ministerial taskforce have been trained on different thematic areas in 2020: training on UPR, human rights treaty reporting follow-up, Children and Armed Conflict, Rights of Persons with Disabilities and Rights/Protection of Women. 10 out of 16 Ministries have had at least 4 people trained on human rights principles and standards 1.1.2: 1 Joint training on how to approach crimes of sexual violence - due to covid no other meetings were convened under this item 1.1.3a: The inter-ministerial taskforce convened two coordination meetings in total. One prior to the studie trip to Rwanda and a meeting after the study tour to discuss the lessons learned. 1.1.3b: Children and Armed Conflict (CAAC) Working Group convened 1 coordination meeting in 2020. 1.1.3c: National Coordination Mechanism at Director-General level on CAAC convened 4 coordination meetings in 2020 1.1.3d: Convened 3 coordination meetings with on Child Protection with IM coordination meeting. Due to covid-19 it wasnt possible to organize more meetings 1.1.3e: 5 coordination meetings held at FGS level with the NAP Steering Committee 1.1.3f: 2 Gender-based violence working group meetings convened, with different stakeholders 1.1.3g: 2 Pillar 9 Working Group coordination meetings held 1.1.3h: No coordination meetings took place this year 1.2.1: No activities have been done with the parliamentary committees under the JP in 2020 1.2.2: No activities have been done with the parliamentary committees under the JP in 2020 2.1.1a: Civil Society Organisations organized 7 trainings for engaging women, national authorities and persons with disabilities 2.1.1b: 2 panel discussions took place for engaging youth on human rights, justice and electrical issues attended by 25 youth ( 16 M; 9 F) on 11 January 2020 in Galkacyo. 2.1.2: 3-day panel discussion took place in Baidoa Southwest on prevention mechanisms and mitigation measures of GBV and women rights 3.1.1: Delayed due to covid-19 and the pending National Persons with Disability Rights bill 3.1.2a: Pending 3.1.2b: Pending

Target 1. 1 inter-ministerial committee with sub-working groups is formed Target 2. 6 meetings of the Steering Committee on the NAP/SVC at national and state level convened Target 3. At least 4 people from each ministry (15 Ministries) are trained Target 4. Human rights and security committees review 3 draft legislation per year on its compliance with human rights (constitution, penal code, counter-terrorism, citizenship, sexual offences, justice for children/juvenile justice) Target 5. 1 training session per committee per quarter on human rights and legislative drafting/review conducted for relevant committees Target 6. 1 civil society network per region/state and 1 main network established at the national level

Result 1. 1-day workshop on womens protection for 40 members from inter-ministerial task force and Benadir district focal points Result 2. 1 Steering Committee on the NAP/SVC convened for 30 stakeholders (F:16; M:14) from line ministries and civil society organizations Result 3. Training on CRC and CAAC for 40 MoWHRD staff and Benadir district focal points. Training on international treaties and mechanisms for 60 participants from MoWHRD, other line ministries, inter-ministerial task force and representatives from FMS Result 4. 1 legal advisor (M) was recruited in April to build and strengthen the capacity of the Gender and Human Rights Committee in the parliament. The legal advisor reviewed the mandate and Terms of Reference of the committee and developed capacity building plans to the Committee Result 5. 1 training session for Parliamentary Gender and Human Rights Committee on rules and procedures of the committee and mandate to ensure legislation in line with human rights Result 6. Selection process of Civil Society organizations/network is under process.
